alert.note: Alert for Pasquotank; Perquimans (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 6:08PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pasquotank and central Perquimans Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a developing strong thunderstorm near Chapanoke, or 7 miles northeast of Winfall. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding of poor drainage areas is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elizabeth City around 620 PM EDT. Hertford, Winfall, Chapanoke and Nixonton around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Bob White Fork, Pasquotank, Rabbit Corner, Beach Springs, Smithtown, Symonds Creek, Whiteston, Parkville, Woodville and Nicanor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
